title: Kitest-based Test Harness
body:
<!--
Thank you for improving Nushell!
Please, read our contributing guide: https://github.com/nushell/nushell/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md
-->
This PR adds the new test harness based on [kitest](https://crates.io/crates/kitest) in `nu-test-support`. It allows us to put tests into groups with shared setup and teardown which will allow us in the future to move integration tests in-process instead of shelling out. It runs without issues with `cargo-nextest` and does not impose changes to existing tests or the way tests have to be written.

But it allows tests to have additional attributes that modify its execution context:
- `#[env(KEY = "value")]` allows setting environment variables for a test
- `#[exp(nu_experimental::EXAMPLE = true)]` allows setting experimental options for a test
- `#[serial]` allows running tests serially instead of multithreaded if they need that

This PR does not introduce changes in the tests themselves (besides some applied test attributes).
